title: SE3D: A Framework For Saliency Method Evaluation In 3D Imaging
abstract: arXiv:2405.14584v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: For more than a decade, deep learning models have been dominating in various 2D imaging tasks. Their application is now extending to 3D imaging, with 3D Convolutional Neural Networks (3D CNNs) being able to process LIDAR, MRI, and CT scans, with significant implications for fields such as autonomous driving and medical imaging. In these critical settings, explaining the model's decisions is fundamental. Despite recent advances in Explainable Artificial Intelligence, however, little effort has been devoted to explaining 3D CNNs, and many works explain these models via inadequate extensions of 2D saliency methods.   A fundamental limitation to the development of 3D saliency methods is the lack of a benchmark to quantitatively assess these on 3D data. To address this issue, we propose SE3D: a framework for Saliency method Evaluation in 3D imaging. We propose modifications to ShapeNet, ScanNet, and BraTS datasets, and evaluation metrics

Title: SE3D: A Framework For Saliency Method Evaluation In 3D Imaging
Abstract: arXiv:2405.14584v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: For more than a decade, deep learning models have been dominating in various 2D imaging tasks. tldr: 该文章提出了一种名为SE3D的框架，用于在3D成像中评估和改进模型的解释性，具体针对3D CNN模型，并提供了专为其设计的评估方案。
